definition: to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to live in harmony/to get along with each other

sentences.english: Always get along long before he discovered the great wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 总是相处很久才会发现他的大智慧。

sentences.english: Zhang Haizhou engages with people well.
sentences.chinese: 张海洲和周围人相处得很好。

sentences.english: Mrs…has never really got on with her daughter-in-law.
sentences.chinese: 老太太从未与儿媳妇儿真正和睦相处过。

sentences.english: Hope in the day of aftertime to get along with everyone delectation.
sentences.chinese: 希望在今后的日子里与大家相处愉快。

sentences.english: They can never get along with each other.
sentences.chinese: 他们永远无法彼此和睦相处。

sentences.english: Do you click well with your colleagues and boss?
sentences.chinese: 你和同事上司相处得融洽吗？

sentences.english: Bernd- Schneider : Actually with everyone, but with the Germans the best.
sentences.chinese: 事实上和每个人都很好，但和德国人相处得最好。

sentences.english: After spending two years together, they are now inseparable.
sentences.chinese: 两年的相处让他们如今形影不离。

sentences.english: And Shen who get along, aroused the feelings of the Chinese man Shen shen.
sentences.chinese: 和沈凡的相处，唤起了曼华对沈凡的情感。
猎狼和孩子相处会怎样？

sentences.english: I agree. Do you get along well with co-workers?
sentences.chinese: 我同意。你跟同事相处得好吗？

sentences.english: Evgeni: When I came to St. Petersburg at 11, we got along immediately.
sentences.chinese: 我十一岁来到圣彼得堡时，我们立刻就相处的很好。

sentences.english: He will teach you how to deel with your girlfriend or lover.
sentences.chinese: 他教你如何和女友或情人相处。

sentences.english: Neilson: And he's spent a lot of time with mortals at this point too.
sentences.chinese: 在这时，他也和凡人相处了很长一段时间了。

sentences.english: In a personal relationship, Saturn in the third can also give difficulty with relatives.
sentences.chinese: 在个人关系里面，土星第三宫也会为相处带来困难。

definition: to associate (with)/to have contact (with)/to hang out (with)/to date/(interpersonal) relationship/association/contact
harmonious/friendly relations/on good terms with one another
emotion/sentiment/affection/feelings between two persons/CL:個|个[ge4],種|种[zhong3]
to coexist/to get along (with others)
intimate/to get close to
each other/one another
to get along well/compatible/also written 和得來|和得来[he2 de5 lai2]
to live in harmony/to get along with each other
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
to make friends/(dialect) to start an affair with sb
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
to love each other
unable to get along together/incompatible
to be at loggerheads/to have a falling out
to work together
